qas.question: Ctenophora and the Cnidaria include what sea creatures?
The digestive chambers of the Ctenophora and the Cnidaria serve as what?

answers.text: both the mouth and the anus

qas.question: What are the 2 main germ systems in the Ctenophora and the Cnidaria called?
What are the Ctenophora and the Cnidaria animals sometimes called?
What differentiates placozoans from the ctenophora and the cnidaria?

answers.text: they do not have a permanent digestive chamber

context: Among the other phyla, the Ctenophora and the Cnidaria, which includes sea <a0_0>anemones, corals, and jellyfish<a0_0/>, are radially symmetric and have digestive chambers with a single opening, which serves as <a1_0>both the mouth and the anus<a1_0/>. Both have distinct tissues, but they are not organized into organs. There are only two main germ layers, the <a2_0>ectoderm and endoderm<a2_0/>, with only scattered cells between them. As such, these animals are sometimes called <a3_0>diploblastic<a3_0/>. The tiny placozoans are similar, but <a4_0>they do not have a permanent digestive chamber<a4_0/>.
